In this case, "The flibbit might be wumbled and quorked" has the form "The flibbit might be A and B", where A is "wumbled" and B is "quorked". Therefore, we can drop the conjunct "wumbled" to infer "The flibbit might be quorked", which has the form "The flibbit might be B".

So based on the rules of propositional logic, the inference is valid.
